page.title: 14WORCESTER'S NEW BRIDGE.
page.content: This bridge, was opened in September 1984. This bridge is about a third of a mile long. It stretches over the river Severn and a large amount of farmland and links up with the road from Worcester to Malvern. The bridge has been built about three miles from the centre of Worcester in an attempt to divert unnecessary traffic away from the city. There are further plans to make a bypass from the bridge to the M5, but this scheme is unable to go ahead until a farmer sells a part of his land which is in the way of the bypass. One result of all this confusion is that so far the bridge is not being used as much as was expected. Another interesting feature about the bridge is that it overlooks the site of the Battle of Worcester.
